0C8F2283A67E4585AE5553EB76813E84.description: I can use assistive technology e.g. tablets and computers and other learning resources to learn about statistics.

91058BDD6DE04639BEE5CE83C3C81DAD.description: Data handling and chance – Statistics (Assistive Technology & Other Resources)

B934536DA590497B8C7096E4F0504F2E.description: I can read and interpret a Carroll diagram.

D85EE475B00D47BE9373405690CBC9DB.description: I can draw a pictograph where the symbol represents one or two units.

B8D620B60022474DB53B5721BBFB4343.description: I can read and interpret a pictograph where the symbol represents one or two units.

C02C979B4BD7415E9BF8BAE8CEDB0619.description: I can work through a situation by representing and interpreting data in tables, graphs and charts.

657ED9B892294F1B912478C8BD76A346.description: I can construct a block graph.

AA050F99A8E64B089DA78AD994A6CD73.description: I can read and interpret a block graph.

63C8AB229A0C4068BB9065FAEAB468D0.description: I can complete a frequency table.

F0F364CE40494967AE63C5AADC0A76DD.description: I can read and interpret a frequency table.

54B1272F1FE44007BBE7C0E6BE5A61D4.description: I can collect, sort, organise and classify data in a table.

D84830CFEC6C418AB735DBDA298C49D2.description: I can use assistive technology e.g. tablets and computers and other resources e.g. 2D and 3D plastic shapes appropriate to this level to learn about transformation geometry.

FC3B9CFC34EC4797929E3837611E2E14.description: Shape, space and measures – Transformation geometry (Assistive Technology & Other Resources)

BF0EA0CCA44D416A8F17746BAE0C2F1D.description: I can describe right angle rotations.

8D521FBCCB4D40C0AC78C0982E7BFD2F.description: Shape, space and measures – Transformation geometry (Rotations)

FEACF9644EF946D8905B4B65F92E5AF4.description: I can draw the other half of a simple symmetrical object inspired by examples of symmetry in nature.

4806D1A455214A75A367CD7D35E89105.description: I can recognise shapes with no, one and two lines of symmetry.

BE56B7FBDDCD496AAF21FD0B7CDA4E2F.description: I can identify and draw lines of symmetry in simple 2D shapes.

C5F5A2CFAF874E899C8BF76141AC6605.description: I can recognise reflective symmetry in a square.

AFC6777867144876B6E89F49BCA69CD2.description: Shape, space and measures – Transformation geometry (Reflections)

6B3E910EC7DC49688F5E460225B9E73E.description: I can describe and find the position of a square on a grid of squares with rows and columns labelled.

A7118DCEE8014A1F81D75E0884885797.description: I can read and write the vocabulary related to position, direction and movement.

17740B41A7EC4B4285047AD843E21116.description: I can understand what right, left, up and down mean and can move an object in each of these directions. I can also describe the movement of the object in each of these directions.

82CD48DBADB84E34BE17B209B267FA56.description: Shape, space and measures – Transformation geometry (Movement)

0B1CD08C0BE14276B5B123D8671BFA83.description: I can use assistive technology e.g. tablets and computers and other resources e.g. 2D and 3D plastic shapes appropriate to this level to learn about measures.

A2AB0728068748B2B6F368D96EF2CC29.description: Shape, space and measures – Euclidean geometry (Assistive Technology & Other Resources)

A9938B474068441FAF6ABB8EFEB22240.description: I can recognise and name the simple 3D shapes: the cube and the cuboid.

65D7DD271D134311B5A22083D2F8A193.description: Shape, space and measures – Euclidean geometry (3D Shapes)

AE0EAE652F69466989C2A64CB43C0C20.description: I can sort, and classify simple 2D shapes using their various properties.

ADF951491292415686FFDA739660544F.description: Shape, space and measures – Euclidean geometry (Polygons)

013B154D418048A4BCD93C07E552305C.description: I can recognise, name, sketch and describe the simple 2D shapes: the square and the rectangle.

398110B6B14348A586BB02D88839876C.description: Shape, space and measures – Euclidean geometry (Quadrilaterals)

5A8D8833D167467688B7708C984935EB.description: I can recognise, name, draw and describe the simple 2D shape: the triangle.

A49F2390D5F84853B3DD4289C1587E6E.description: Shape, space and measures – Euclidean geometry (Triangles)

A01EBBC903304ED9B5919F56CAA83D8D.description: I can describe and draw pictures and patterns.

FE145F1B55B7433EA8C4B27884526D0A.description: Shape, space and measures – Euclidean geometry (Lines & Lines Segments)

06E48F553F7A47308F29618AE59EAD0C.description: I can use assistive technology e.g. tablets and computers and other resources e.g. plastic money, cardboard clocks, 2D and 3D plastic shapes, measuring instruments appropriate to this level to learn about measures.

0387C006CEBC4DD1B370FFB23AC8445C.description: Shape, space and measures – Measures (Assistive Technology & Other Resources)

FFBC1B9FB92D42E1B28B614E562B1149.description: I can estimate and measure time using seconds, minutes and hours.

DC54F0CFAC7849FFA8DB952D5EC06CE3.description: I can read and use a calendar.

AA56DEB16074427CAED660AF47AD48B1.description: I can read and use the 12 hour clock in both analogue and digital.

A03665857D884B5B9B07A9E268ED9BBC.description: I can convert and use larger to smaller standard units of time i.e hours, minutes and seconds, and vice versa.

A7327676BFC4430E8F26D526930FE3DC.description: I can use standard units of time and know the relationships between them.

B4E804464D454277906A0670F9CA6ED3.description: I can read and write the vocabulary related to time.

14AD442E59AB4712AF7BE49AB68F02C9.description: I can draw a line to the nearest centimetre.

5F6689BC334D4FF3A013F52134280234.description: I can suggest and use measuring equipment to estimate and/or measure length mass and capacity.

583120C853DE44F2A5107E7D6E377030.description: I can convert and use larger to smaller standard metric units of mass i.e. kg, g; length i.e. km, m, cm, mm; and capacity i.e. l, ml, and vice versa.

D934C7D60FAD436E8B3BA7797987A36F.description: I can use the decimal notation to express measures of length, mass and capacity.

7827C2E9DED740D0A80E78BE9A9CED4F.description: I can estimate, measure and compare lengths, masses, and, capacities.

021EA6BA56A142608DEFE8688EB0B1A7.description: I know the standard metric units of length i.e kilometres, metres, centimetres and millimetre; mass i.e kilograms and grams; and, capacity i.e litres and millilitres. I also know the abbreviations of these standard units and I can understand the relationships between different units of the same measure.

E997F65C52784B4D81ADFAB3A262284C.description: I can read and write the vocabulary related to length, mass and capacity.

AC7B2DC3B4BE4EDCAF0AEB2F288816AB.description: I can understand that the capacity of a container is the total amount of fluid that can be poured into the container.

9C6F779B1B154BC39D509742FC8C3440.description: I can understand that the mass of an object is a measure of the amount of material in an object.

2BB05F6F331A49158DA453112FC236D4.description: I can understand that the length of an object is a measure of distance between the endpoints of an object.

E28B048D84D04EC38F22401378A4A97B.description: Shape, space and measures – Measures (Length, Area, Volume, Mass & Capacity)

BB41C72442B446A09C13768F21F99671.description: I can compare an angle with a right angle.

20FF3FDA293149BF9E32F6EE252BD35B.description: I can recognise, measure and draw angles of 90° and 180° without the use of a protractor.

30E1CF12B7564554B1B2A5B222546596.description: I can make and describe right angle turns including turns between the four compass points.

6C2D27B1421040F588D686542B77A032.description: I can understand that a right angle is a quarter of a whole turn and can recognise such angles in 2D shapes and in the environment.

255F9F242FCA40EF8EF337406058CB59.description: I can show and label the four compass points.

6D492F57FE5F458488E5716DD9781E72.description: I can use assisitive technology e.g. tablets and computers and other resources appropiate to this level to learn about the fundamentals of algebra.

F114F4E9E9844BC68CD0B22D5ADD8A5C.description: Algebra – Fundamentals of Algebra (Assistive Technology & Other Resources)

061C46F145564DE9867C5827D03B4AAB.description: I can recognise the use of an empty box symbol to stand in for an unknown number and can find the unknown number.

A91F68318E154538BEE541BA6D5C9497.description: I can recognise and extend simple pictorial patterns and number sequences formed by counting any positive integer in constant steps.

125323037AB64EA59C0A641903E61C74.description: I can use assistive technology e.g. tablets and computers and other resources e.g. Cuisenaire rods, Unifix cubes, base 10 blocks appropriate to this level to calculate and to learn about numerical calculations.

94DC597629BA4D88B8730614E20BF8DA.description: Number - Numerical calculations (Assistive Technology & Other Resources)

1499DF0799E84881A003956CBF29F4B0.description: I can understand that prices marked as €0.99 are a marketing strategy to make prices more attractive.

38896A41D39846B4A9A2BDE53318921F.description: I can use receipts, simple menus, entrance tickets to work out totals and change.

08AD3938194D41039B4C3CDF0E9C6D06.description: I can plan an activity within a given budget e.g. using tickets, travel brochures, price lists, menus ...

B5522ED6070D4C5AAB40E82BECC5E9F9.description: I can handle small amounts of money in classroom situations e.g. keeping track of money collected from small change for charity money collections.

A18F5A97E2D54C7183D2EA7BA47B841B.description: I can work out totals up to a hundred euro and give the correct change.

61EB45643EAD4543B78514FA1C9AE0E5.description: I can understand that 1 euro is equal to 100 cent.

5B005E10A67F47FDA7582044329D7DC1.description: I can read and interpret scales involving whole numbers.

CD30B4D7C7D34A7C9F35DB59C25A9286.description: I can find fractions of shapes and simple whole numbers.

77C5996AA25646E3B6A11CAB26230926.description: I can round any whole two-digit number to the nearest ten and any three-digit number to the nearest hundred.

754E904802DB4AF2ABAC6E0581B57A11.description:
I can work through simple one-step situations using addition, subtraction, multiplication and/or division.
I can also give a rough estimate of the answer of such situations and I can check the reasonableness of the answer.

549291FE48324C5595B5A5C15F7707FC.description: I can find remainders after division, restricted to dividends up to 100 and divisors up to 10.

7474FB8C604243C98E8459C1BE0DD311.description: I can understand halving as the inverse of doubling.

3C0FBF89E46949E6B1BE9641D1292D7F.description: I can halve even numbers up to 500.

BBE49EF1691E4EE0A7B7A3FBB6868026.description: I can double whole numbers up to 500.

FECECDDBCE154D7D82F22CC3A6BC322A.description: I can recognise unit fractions such as ½ and ¼ and use them to find fractions of shapes and numbers. I can also understand the relationship between fractions such as ½ and ¼ and division e.g. ½ means 1 ÷ 2 and vice versa.

57982F1E31BD4592A4D8C69FBF8F675C.description: I can mentally multiply an integer by multiples of 10 and 100.

07D7E3366899493CA892B537D61CE3ED.description: I can understand that division is the inverse of multiplication. I can also state and write a division statement corresponding to a given multiplication statement i.e 2, 3, 4, 5 and 10 multiplication facts, and vice versa e.g. if 4 × 3 = 12 then 12 ÷ 3 = 4 and vice versa.

7A2EDA0F584846E5A48A14CC65A47563.description: I can understand division as equal grouping or repeated subtraction.

62A572497B194C70B5AA213D914D697F.description: I can understand division as equal sharing.

D1EA49DCC2724F358D9F2DCBB1238A98.description: I can understand that I can multiply numbers in any order and get the same result.

D819E98980A74CCFADBBC2D59778C298.description: I can understand that multiplication is multiple groups or repeated addition.

11C6A1EFF24B4B4FB61ACABD305F49B6.description: I can derive all pairs of multiples of 100 with a total of 1000.

8E4FF281FDF344D3AD528DF38DA885CB.description: I can derive all pairs of multiples of 50 with a total of 1000.

2086A74159AA45138715FCE07BF8EE8E.description: I can derive all number pairs that total 100.

E306A4B253674D32A7E433A99CAFB1F4.description: I can derive all pairs of 100 in multiples of 5 and 10.

25C6A7342DDD492D82D6B543D2A9614B.description: I can work through situations involving addition and subtraction with two-digit numbers.

25551ED7EBB8421BB472B36AA1553896.description: I can use column addition and subtraction with up to three-digit numbers.

A5BE61A8E9734FA1AC25BAB70CCA556B.description: I can add/subtract 9 or 11 by adding/subtracting 10 and then adjusting by 1.

52D962666E7E4786B4BFC9457E6B1090.description: I can understand that subtraction is the inverse of addition and vice versa. I can also state and write a substraction statement corresponding to a given addition statement and vice versa e.g. if 4 + 3 = 7 then 7 - 3 = 4 and vice versa.

9A01092CFED94AC1888B111D7C6F4B2E.description: I can work out a small difference by counting up from the smaller to the larger number.

6D1EB693B57743ABB04C473FBDE273BD.description: I can understand that I can add numbers in any order and get the same result.

21D749C34B494A07B7655A8CB2C27CDE.description: I can add 100 or 1,000 to any whole number.

0F105A92043544AEBA0FE73014E7D108.description: Number - Numerical calculations (Whole Numbers, Decimal Numbers & Fraction Numbers - The Four Operations)

31D43A33B29D4D018600194725A1007F.description: I can use assistive technology e.g. tablets and computers and other learning resources e.g. Cuisenaire rods, Unifix cubes to learn about numbers and their properties.

0A7A62BC4A93430F9A1622F8DD04D5DA.description: Number - The number system (Assistive Technology & Other Resources)

7B7F3B6D0F724A738357D887F940B620.description: I can state one number lying between two whole numbers.

250F609696EA455D9774D8F057690306.description: I can compare and order simple fractions and position them on a number line.

D2B4349BE3D44B558BE3EFD83BA632A7.description: I can recognise and use simple equivalent fractions.

61B5B1793B8F4B07AEF284DA6E6C7A1C.description: I can recognise mixed numbers which include a whole number and a fraction.

4F7BA4139C94437CBF1973FF886ACB40.description: I can recognise simple fractions that are parts of a whole.

B1D458177C4B4980B25808D11EED5801.description: I can understand that 0.5 represents a half.

AA6FEC6C79FD40F08F0AD9DB4DFADEAA.description: I can understand that 0.1 represents a tenth.

95B0AE4B46754C37ABB0E9844CFE1192.description: I can understand what a half and a quarter are and can recognise them in shapes and in small numbers of objects.

98E22BDF4B974003A1955DB90EFEDC3B.description: I can recall the first ten multiples of the following numbers: 2, 3, 4, 5, 8 & 10.

0A079DDDB6DB453CA7A416FB3F567C4D.description: I can count forward/backwards in steps of 25 and 50 to/from 500.

B66448B6D60C4C0993A2C16C2E1C7958.description: I can count forward and backwards in steps of 3, 4, or 5 to and from any whole number less than or equal to 50.

468EE8741C0C496587C2C3E080E23E77.description: I can count forward and backwards in 1s, 2s, 10s and 100s starting from any whole number less than or equal to 1000.

FCA5AB509A2E47BAB082282421E6443B.description: I can identify odd and even numbers to ten thousand.

EF4DEE8AA49544B28012B5F15F6AF681.description: I can read, say, order and write ordinal numbers to one hundred.

F52F1F96ED9D48A7A2050F7420CC9AA9.description: I can compare and order whole numbers up to ten thousand and include symbols such as <, > or =.

65AD16E41BBE43EB9D4F2BC79C11D4E1.description: I Can understand the place value of any digit in a whole number up to ten thousand.

DE218F8DB69043C7844A2FAE90AD1CBE.description: I can recognise, read and position whole numbers on a number line.

7F209B78677E470C91690002D38A193A.description: I can read, write and order whole numbers to ten thousand in figures and words.
